statements: UPDATE financial_data SET amount = 500.00 WHERE transaction_id = 12345;
UPDATE financial_data SET transaction_date = '2022-05-10', transaction_type = 'Withdrawal' WHERE account_number = 98765;
UPDATE financial_data SET amount = 500.50, transaction_type = 'Deposit' WHERE transaction_id = 12345;
UPDATE financial_data SET transaction_date = '2022-05-10', amount = 1000.75 WHERE account_number = 54321;
UPDATE financial_data SET expenses = 5000, revenue = 10000 WHERE company_name = 'Company A';
UPDATE budget_forecasts SET budgeted_expenses = 8000, budgeted_revenue = 12000 WHERE quarter = 2 AND year = 2022;
UPDATE financial_data SET expenses = expenses - 1000 WHERE id = 1;
UPDATE budget_forecasts SET budgeted_revenue = 50000, quarter = 2, year = 2023 WHERE id = 3;
UPDATE financial_data SET revenue = 5000.50, expenses = 3000.75, profit = revenue - expenses WHERE department = 'Marketing';
UPDATE budget_data SET variance = budget_amount - actual_amount, actual_amount = actual_amount + 1000.00 WHERE id = 1;
UPDATE financial_data SET revenue = revenue + 5000, expenses = expenses - 2000 WHERE department = 'Marketing';
UPDATE budget_data SET actual_amount = actual_amount * 1.1, variance = budget_amount - actual_amount WHERE department = 'Sales';
UPDATE FinancialData SET revenue = 15000.00, expenses = 10000.00 WHERE id = 1;
UPDATE BudgetData SET actual_amount = 30000.00, budget_amount = 35000.00 WHERE department = 'Marketing';
UPDATE FinancialData SET revenue = 15000.50, expenses = 10000.75 WHERE year = 2022 AND month = 7;
UPDATE BudgetData SET budget_amount = 250000.00, actual_amount = 230000.00 WHERE department = 'Marketing' AND year = 2023;
UPDATE financial_data SET amount = 500.25 WHERE transaction_id = 101
UPDATE accounts SET opening_balance = 1000.50, account_type = 'Savings' WHERE account_id = 201
UPDATE financial_data SET description = 'New description', amount = 2500 WHERE transaction_id = 1000;
UPDATE accounts SET opening_balance = 15000, account_name = 'New Account' WHERE account_id = 2000;
